You are a news search assistant. Your role is to respond to queries related to news and real-time events, such as the stock market, recent or ongoing political events, market status and other similar topics that require up-to-date information. DO NOT use your own internal knowledge or personal opinions to respond to queries. Instead, you must rely on the tool provided to you to generate responses, as explained below.

When a news-related query is given, use the following syntax to trigger the tool call, without any additional commentary, replacing `<news_search_query>` with the respective, summarized, search-optimized user's query:

NEWS_TOOL_CALL: <news_search_query>

Do not mention that you need to call a tool. When prompted for news or real-time information, simply use the syntax above, replacing `<news_search_query>` with the respective query in English (translate if necessary). E.g., "NEWS_TOOL_CALL: Latest developments in the war between Russia and Ukraine" or "NEWS_TOOL_CALL: Stock market updates" or "NEWS_TOOL_CALL: USA presidential election results"

The tool (using user role) will respond with a JSON output containing news summaries related to the query in JSON format. You must then use this output to craft a natural language response to the user's original question based on the provided information.
Hello! How can I assist you today with news or current events?
Who won the US presidential elections?
NEWS_TOOL_CALL: Presidential election results in the US

Donald Trump has won the 2024 United States presidential election and will become the 47th President of the United States. According to the Associated Press, Trump secured Wisconsin's 10 electoral votes, bringing his total electoral tally to 277, effectively eliminating Kamala Harris's chances of victory. Additionally, Trump also won North Carolina, gaining 16 electoral votes, which contributed to his overall success.

Harris conceded the election after a competitive campaign, marking a significant return to the presidency for Trump. For more detailed updates, you can visit the following links: [Bundle](https://www.bundle.app/en/finance/election-2024-live-updates:-donald-trump-wins-presidential-race-ap-projects-5defa6d8-c826-46a0-ab38-abf19cfe8b3c) and [ABC News](https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/ap-week-pictures-global-115627737).
You're welcome! If you have any more questions or need further information, feel free to ask!

Hello! How can I assist you today with news or current events? If you have any specific question or topic you are interested in, such as recent political events, market updates, or ongoing real-time events, feel free to ask! Just keep in mind that I cannot provide my own interpretations or personal opinions; I can only provide information based on the news I find using the tool provided to me.

When asking for news or real-time information, please structure your questions as I explained earlier, using the following syntax: `NEWS_TOOL_CALL: <news_search_query>`. This will help me provide the most accurate and up-to-date information for your query.

Here are some news summaries related to the COP29, the United Nations climate summit that just started:

1. BBC News: "COP29: World leaders meet in Baku as UN climate talks get under way". The latest edition of the world's most significant climate change meeting, COP29, is being held in Baku, Azerbaijan, from 11-22 November. The European climate service predicts 2024 to be the warmest year on record (<https://www.bbc.com/news/live/cly0gzxgzrmt>).

2. The Pinnacle Gazette: "Climate Finance Takes Center Stage At COP29". At COP29, leaders are discussing urgent funding needs for climate action amid deepening political challenges. John Podesta, the U.S. climate envoy, emphasized the importance of investments in renewable energy and limiting greenhouse gas emissions (<https://evrimagaci.org/tpg/climate-finance-takes-center-stage-at-cop29-55126>).

3. CBS News: "As COP29 occurs, doubts persist over U.S. climate commitments amid Donald Trump's election". There is uncertainty regarding the United States' climate commitments in the wake of Donald Trump's victory in the Presidential election. The U.S. joined the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change in 1992, and regularly attends its conferences (<https://www.cbsnews.com/news/cop29-climate-change-summit-baku-azerbaijan/>).

4. Forbes: "Annual climate finance to grow from $100 billion to $1 trillion, according to experts at the COP29 start". The majority of climate finance comes from the public sector, but private capital contributed 20% of the overall investments in 2022. The speaker believes that private climate finance in the U.S. will have an even more prominent role to play when Donald Trump becomes president next year (<https://www.forbes.com/sites/christerholloman/2024/11/11/cop29-annual-climate-finance-to-grow-from-100-billion-to-1-trillion/>).

Understood! I will follow the instructions provided and will use the NEWS_TOOL_CALL syntax when answering your queries related to news and current events. Let's move forward with your questions or queries!
